ygData.subject: Re: Is there any hope?  was RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not one now but unless things have changed very dramatically I d say your issue is going to wind up in the hands of the server GM.  It s going to wind up
ygData.messageBody:
I'm not one now but unless things have changed very dramatically I'd say
your issue is going to wind up in the hands of the server GM. It's going to
wind up being a discretionary call on his part. They have said, repeatedly,
that the no-drop flag isn't perfect and that they wouldn't reimburse dropped
items.

However in the extenuating circumstances you describe myself and my former
gm would reimburse the loss most likely. Depending on your past reputation
and number of warnings on your account (we used this for credibility
purposes).

I'd say you have about a 70/30 chance.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath

----- Original Message -----
From: "Peck White" <pwhite@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 25, 2000 8:12 AM
Subject: Is there any hope? was RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed


> Monday night I did a dumb thing. My inventory was full from having
> adventured for 4 or 5 days without visiting a merchant, so I refreshed my
DE
> illusion, memmed Carillon and went to Tin Merchant IX in the Overthere. I
> switched out my weapons for the drum to run there. There wasn't a slot
open
> so I just left my Wraith Bone Hammer floating on the pointer. I know, I
> know, I should've destroyed some muffins or carried them on the pointer.
> Hindsight is 20/20. Anyway I left clicked on the merchant to target him
for
> the Carillon and the trade window came up. I cancelled the trade and the
> Hammer dropped to the ground and the merchant picked it up and destroyed
it.
> I had Nodrop set to confirm. I immediately petitioned it.
>
> The Guide after some discussion promoted my petition to the Senior Guide.
> The Senior Guide spoke to me Tuesday night, he wasn't online on Monday,
and
> asked where and when the event occurred. He never got back to me before
he
> logged and I finally logged myself. I haven't heard back from him yet.
>
> In my opinion even in this situation the confirm drop window should have
> come up and I could then have emptied an inventory slot, picking up
> something less valuable to drop.
>
> Since you've been a Senior Guide, tell me, do I have any hope?
>
> Tomerrilin
> the butterfingers bard
>
> ----Original Message-----
> From: Lyrnia Jongleur [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 24, 2000 8:37 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed
>
>
> Ok hows this:
>
> I was a Senior Guide for 11 months
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
